purpleculture_pinyin:
lái
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc); Chenopodium album
название сорного растения (жирная курица, гусиная лапка, поросенок и т. д.); Chenopodium альбом

heisig_chinese_memo: Lambsquarters are flowers that come and go with the seasons.
Ru_trainchinese: lái: (графема) (буот.) марь белая; лебеда; сорняки, сорная трава; невозделанное поле, пустырь; используется в транслитерации
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When flowers come other weedy plants like lambsquarters are sure to come as well.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "艸", " come ", the original meaning is Chenopodium, a herbaceous plant, tender seedlings are edible and can be used as wild vegetables. "Shuowen": "Manhua also. From the chase, the sound." "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧Nanshan has a platform": "There is a platform in the South Mountain, and there is a Lai in the North Mountain." Lu Jishu: "Lai, the name of the grass, its leaves Edible."

" Lai " can mean fallow fields in the suburbs. "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧County Division": "Distinguish the number of people's land and Lai in his husband's family."

Zheng Xuan's note: "Lai, those who have not cultivated, the suburbs are called Yi, and the suburbs are called Lai."

" Lai " also means overgrown weeds. "Poetry·Xiaoya·The Turn of October": "Through my wall house, the field will be dirty."

" Lai " also means weeding. "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧Shanyu": "If hunting in the field, then Laishan field will be wild." Zheng Xuan's note: "Lai, weeding the grass."
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸", " lai " sound, the original meaning is quinoa.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「來」聲，本義為藜，草本植物，嫩苗可食，可做野菜。《說文》：「蔓華也。从艸，來聲。」 《詩‧小雅‧南山有臺》：「南山有臺，北山有萊。」陸璣疏：「萊，草名，其葉可食。」

　　「萊」可表示郊外休耕的田地。《周禮‧地官‧縣師》：「辨其夫家人民田萊之數。」

　　鄭玄注：「萊，休不耕者，郊內謂之易，郊外謂之萊。」

　　「萊」也表示叢生的雜草。《詩‧小雅‧十月之交》：「徹我牆屋，田卒汙萊。」

　　「萊」還表示除草。《周禮‧地官‧山虞》：「若大田獵，則萊山田之野。」鄭玄注：「萊，除其草萊也。」

從「 艸 」，「 來 」聲，本義為藜，草本植物，嫩苗可食，可做野菜。《說文》：「蔓華也。从艸，來聲。」 《詩‧小雅‧南山有臺》：「南山有臺，北山有萊。」陸璣疏：「萊，草名，其葉可食。」 「 萊 」可表示郊外休耕的田地。《周禮‧地官‧縣師》：「辨其夫家人民田萊之數。」 鄭玄注：「萊，休不耕者，郊內謂之易，郊外謂之萊。」 「 萊 」也表示叢生的雜草。《詩‧小雅‧十月之交》：「徹我牆屋，田卒汙萊。」 「 萊 」還表示除草。《周禮‧地官‧山虞》：「若大田獵，則萊山田之野。」鄭玄注：「萊，除其草萊也。」
From the sound of " 艸", " come", the original meaning is Chenopodium, a herbaceous plant, tender seedlings are edible and can be used as wild vegetables. "Shuowen": "Manhua also. From the chase, the sound." "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧Nanshan has a platform": "There is a platform in the South Mountain, and there is a Lai in the North Mountain." Lu Jishu: "Lai, the name of the grass, its leaves Edible." " Lai" can mean fallow fields in the suburbs. "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧County Division": "Distinguish the number of people's land and Lai in his husband's family." Zheng Xuan's note: "Lai, those who have not cultivated, the suburbs are called Yi, and the suburbs are called Lai." " Lai" also means overgrown weeds. "Poetry·Xiaoya·The Turn of October": "Through my wall house, the field will be dirty." " Lai" also means weeding. "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧Shanyu": "If hunting in the field, then Laishan field will be wild." Zheng Xuan's note: "Lai, weeding the grass."
